result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:31 PM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Andrew Nettesheim in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Kurt H Egerer.  
Defendant Kurt H Egerer not in court.  
Court waives defendant's appearance for today.
Attorney Tapia requests a different date for plea/sentencing.
Court grants.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:00 AM   File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kurt H Egerer in court by zoom with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Tapia requests a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:21 AM Defendant Kurt H Egerer in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.

CONDITIONS:
Defendant is to have No Contact with the Goodwill Store listed in the Criminal Complaint

Case called at 10:07 AM
Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant did not appear in court.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia appeared in court.
State requests a Capias and Bail be revoked and forfeited.
Court will issue a Capias.  Bail to be revoked and forfeited.
Defendant appeared in court at 10:39 a.m.

Court recalls the case at 10:54 a.m.
Court will NOT issue the Capias.
Bail will NOT be revoked/forfeited.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court tolls the time limits for preliminary hearing/Time limits waived.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

State presented their bail arguments.
Defense presented their bail arguments.
Court sets a Signature Bond in the amount of $1,000.00
CONDITIONS:
Defendant is to have No Contact with the Goodwill Store listed in the Criminal Complaint

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:15 am.
